20101225070938.000|20101225070939.000|CC1|ON STAGE AND YOU FORGET THE

20101225070943.000|20101225070945.000|CC1|EVENTUALLY, IF YOU DO THIS LONG 
20101225070945.000|20101225070947.000|CC1|ENOUGH, AT JUST ABOUT ANYTHING

20101225070952.000|20101225070953.000|CC1|AND BROKEN A BONE.

20101225070954.000|20101225070958.000|CC1|WITH ENOUGH REPETITION, YOU     
20101225070958.000|20101225070958.000|CC1|REALIZE YOU COULD SURVIVE AND   
20101225070958.000|20101225071000.000|CC1|KEEP GOING.                     
20101225071000.000|20101225071003.000|CC1|TAVIS: YOU ARE ALWAYS SHARPER   
20101225071003.000|20101225071005.000|CC1|THAN ANY GUEST I HAVE HAD ON THE
20101225071005.000|20101225071005.000|CC1|PROGRAM.

20101225071724.000|20101225071725.000|CC1|WAS TO DO HOUSEHOLD CHORES?     
20101225071725.000|20101225071732.000|CC1|>> RIGHT, CONNIE COX WAS HER    
20101225071732.000|20101225071733.000|CC1|NAME, WONDERFUL LADY.           
20101225071733.000|20101225071736.000|CC1|I MET HER WHEN I WAS 13, STUDIED
20101225071736.000|20101225071740.000|CC1|WITH HER ABOUT SEVEN YEARS.     
20101225071740.000|20101225071742.000|CC1|OF COURSE, I COULD NOT PAY, BUT 
20101225071742.000|20101225071744.000|CC1|I CLEAN HER STUDIO, IN THE      
20101225071744.000|20101225071747.000|CC1|STUDIO WHERE SHE TAUGHT MUSIC.  
20101225071747.000|20101225071751.000|CC1|I WOULD CLEAN THE STUDIO, RUN   
20101225071751.000|20101225071753.000|CC1|ERRANDS FOR HER, AND DID THINGS 
20101225071753.000|20101225071755.000|CC1|BETWEEN HER PAID STUDENTS.      
20101225071755.000|20101225071757.000|CC1|I WOULD SIT IN THE CORNER AND DO
20101225071757.000|20101225071759.000|CC1|MY HOMEWORK AND LISTEN TO THE   
20101225071759.000|20101225071759.000|CC1|PAYING STUDENTS.                
20101225071759.000|20101225071801.000|CC1|I THINK THAT IS WHERE I REALLY

20101225071820.000|20101225071821.000|CC1|SEVEN YEARS, PUSHING YOU INTO   
20101225071821.000|20101225071823.000|CC1|TIME TO GO TO COLLEGE.          
20101225071823.000|20101225071826.000|CC1|WHAT MANY FANS MAY NOT KNOW, YOU
20101225071826.000|20101225071828.000|CC1|WERE AN AMAZING ATHLETE, SO

20101225071832.000|20101225071834.000|CC1|TO TRY OUT FOR THE OLYMPIC TEAM

20101225071842.000|20101225071847.000|CC1|>> IN THE SAME WEEK, ONE WEEK, I
20101225071847.000|20101225071848.000|CC1|HAD TO EITHER DO ONE OR THE

20101225071911.000|20101225071913.000|CC1|MENTOR TO PEOPLE LIKE MAHALIA   
20101225071913.000|20101225071917.000|CC1|JACKSON, AN ENORMOUS PEOPLE, AND

20101225071923.000|20101225071925.000|CC1|YORK, MAKE MY FIRST RECORDING

20101225071928.000|20101225071931.000|CC1|THE MODERN JAZZ QUARTET, -- TO

20101225071939.000|20101225071942.000|CC1|JAZZ ICONS AT THE TIME.         
20101225071942.000|20101225071944.000|CC1|I WAS OVER THE MOON ABOUT       
20101225071944.000|20101225071946.000|CC1|RECORDING, SO I DID.            
20101225071946.000|20101225071948.000|CC1|I WENT TO NEW YORK AND MADE MY  
20101225071948.000|20101225071949.000|CC1|FIRST RECORDING.                
20101225071949.000|20101225071952.000|CC1|TAVIS: YOU'RE BACK STORY IS SO  
20101225071952.000|20101225071953.000|CC1|PHENOMENAL TO ME.               
20101225071953.000|20101225071956.000|CC1|WHAT I AM ABOUT TO SAY IS       
20101225071956.000|20101225071958.000|CC1|UNHEARD OF, YOU SIGNED, PASSED  
20101225071958.000|20101225072002.000|CC1|ON THE OLYMPICS, SIGNED WITH
